list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Refactor Celery configuration for better SSL support
Updated Celery settings to use SSL-compatible Redis URLs, ensuring compatibility with `rediss://` connections. Simplified configuration by adjusting relevant settings and initialization in `settings.py` and `celery.py`. This enhances security and eliminates redundant logic.

component.name: DjangoConsoleOptions

option.name: myCustomStartScript

project.component: { "keyToString": { "ASKED_SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "Django Server.EneoNewsletter.executor": "Run", "Docker.Dockerfile (1).executor": "Run", "Docker.Dockerfile.executor": "Run", "Docker.docker-compose.yml.web: Compose Deployment.executor": "Run", "Docker.docker-compose.yml: Compose Deployment.executor": "Run", "ModuleVcsDetector.initialDetectionPerformed": "true", "RunOnceActivity.OpenDjangoStructureViewOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.ShowReadmeOnStart": "true", "RunOnceActivity.git.unshallow": "true", "RunOnceActivity.pycharm.django.structure.promotion.once.per.project": "true", "SHARE_PROJECT_CONFIGURATION_FILES": "true", "SHELLCHECK.PATH": "/home/landry/.local/share/JetBrains/PyCharm2025.1/Shell Script/shellcheck", "dart.analysis.tool.window.visible": "false", "git-widget-placeholder": "main", "last_opened_file_path": "/home/landry/Dev/MANUELLA/Studroom/backend", "node.js.detected.package.eslint": "true", "node.js.detected.package.tslint": "true", "node.js.selected.package.eslint": "(autodetect)", "node.js.selected.package.tslint": "(autodetect)", "nodejs_package_manager_path": "npm", "settings.editor.selected.configurable": "preferences.pluginManager", "vue.rearranger.settings.migration": "true" } }

task.summary:
Add initial migrations for Newsletter and Subscriber models
Introduce database migrations to create Newsletter and Subscriber models. The Newsletter model handles email subject, content, and status, while the Subscriber model manages user subscription details, including email, token, and activity status.

Add initial migrations for Newsletter and Subscriber models
Introduce database migrations to create Newsletter and Subscriber models. The Newsletter model handles email subject, content, and status, while the Subscriber model manages user subscription details, including email, token, and activity status.

Add Celery integration and newsletter async email tasks
Introduced Celery to handle asynchronous tasks in the project, including integration settings and a task to send newsletters to active subscribers. Also added a 'neighborhood' field to the Subscriber model. These changes enable efficient email delivery and improve subscriber management.

Update SQL data source definitions for routines and packages
Adjusted collation definitions and reorganized routines and packages in the SQL data source file. Introduced new JSON-related and window function routines, ensuring compatibility and enhanced functionality for updated server version 3.45.1.

Add Coupure app with notifications system and Docker setup
Introduce a new "Coupure" app for managing electricity outages with features to notify affected subscribers. Added Docker, Celery, and Redis for task management and scalability, along with Django migrations, templates, and admin configurations.

Update Subscriber model and add project setup documentation
Made the 'neighborhood' field in the Subscriber model mandatory. Added a comprehensive README for project setup, including installation, prerequisites, and deployment guidelines. Updated .gitignore to exclude environment-specific files.

Update project setup: add superuser script and revise configs
Added `create_superuser.py` for automatic superuser creation in the project setup. Updated `Dockerfile` to include migrations and superuser creation commands. Commented out unused CSRF settings, database configurations, and associated dependencies in `docker-compose.yml` for streamlined development.

Configure Redis and update Docker networking
Added Redis configuration (host and port) in settings.py. Updated docker-compose.yml to include an isolated `app-network` for services and adjusted Redis port mapping. These changes enhance container orchestration and environment alignment.

Update database configuration to use environment variables
Replaced hardcoded SQLite configuration with dynamic settings using `dj_database_url` and `DATABASE_URL` environment variable. This change improves flexibility and prepares the project for different deployment environments. Unused database configurations have been commented out for clarity.

Update database configuration to use environment variables
Replaced `os.getenv` with `decouple.config` for retrieving the `DATABASE_URL`. This improves security, flexibility, and compatibility across various environments. Adjusted settings to align with best practices for managing environment-specific configurations.

Refactor settings and Docker configuration.
Replaced `decouple.config` with `os.getenv` for environment variable management in settings, improving compatibility. Consolidated and streamlined Docker setup by revising commands, removing redundant steps, and adjusting the `env_file` format. These changes enhance maintainability and simplify project deployment.

Refactor Dockerfile to include superuser creation.
Updated the Dockerfile to add a step for creating a superuser during the start-up process. This ensures better automation and consistency in the deployment workflow. Also refined related configuration and comments for clarity and maintainability.

Update Celery config to use environment variables
Replaced hardcoded Redis URLs in Celery configuration with values retrieved from environment variables using `os.environ.get`. This improves flexibility and allows for easier adjustments across environments. Default values are preserved for local development.

Update Dockerfile to remove superuser creation step
Removed the automatic superuser creation step from the Dockerfile startup command. This streamlines the deployment process and avoids potential issues during container initialization. Manual superuser creation can now be handled separately if needed.

Refactor Celery, admin, and Docker configurations.
Updated Celery settings to support Redis URLs with SSL and refined admin methods for better clarity and functionality. Removed the automatic superuser creation step from Dockerfile for streamlined deployment. Adjusted `docker-compose.yml` and other configurations to enhance maintainability and compatibility.

Refactor admin display and comment out unused method
Removed the `get_notified_subscribers_count` field from `list_display` in `CoupureAdmin` and commented out its corresponding method for clarity. These changes simplify the admin interface and remove unused functionality while preserving the method for potential future use.

Refactor Celery configuration for better SSL support
Simplified Celery settings by using `broker_use_ssl` for SSL configuration with Redis URLs. This approach eliminates redundant logic while ensuring compatibility with `rediss://` connections. Adjusted relevant settings and initialization in `celery.py` accordingly.

Refactor Celery configuration for better SSL support
Updated Celery settings to use SSL-compatible Redis URLs, ensuring compatibility with `rediss://` connections. Simplified configuration by adjusting relevant settings and initialization in `settings.py` and `celery.py`. This enhances security and eliminates redundant logic.

MESSAGE.value:
Add initial migrations for Newsletter and Subscriber models
Introduce database migrations to create Newsletter and Subscriber models. The Newsletter model handles email subject, content, and status, while the Subscriber model manages user subscription details, including email, token, and activity status.

Add Celery integration and newsletter async email tasks
Introduced Celery to handle asynchronous tasks in the project, including integration settings and a task to send newsletters to active subscribers. Also added a 'neighborhood' field to the Subscriber model. These changes enable efficient email delivery and improve subscriber management.

Update SQL data source definitions for routines and packages
Adjusted collation definitions and reorganized routines and packages in the SQL data source file. Introduced new JSON-related and window function routines, ensuring compatibility and enhanced functionality for updated server version 3.45.1.

Add Coupure app with notifications system and Docker setup
Introduce a new "Coupure" app for managing electricity outages with features to notify affected subscribers. Added Docker, Celery, and Redis for task management and scalability, along with Django migrations, templates, and admin configurations.

Update Subscriber model and add project setup documentation
Made the 'neighborhood' field in the Subscriber model mandatory. Added a comprehensive README for project setup, including installation, prerequisites, and deployment guidelines. Updated .gitignore to exclude environment-specific files.

Update project setup: add superuser script and revise configs
Added `create_superuser.py` for automatic superuser creation in the project setup. Updated `Dockerfile` to include migrations and superuser creation commands. Commented out unused CSRF settings, database configurations, and associated dependencies in `docker-compose.yml` for streamlined development.

Configure Redis and update Docker networking
Added Redis configuration (host and port) in settings.py. Updated docker-compose.yml to include an isolated `app-network` for services and adjusted Redis port mapping. These changes enhance container orchestration and environment alignment.

Update database configuration to use environment variables
Replaced hardcoded SQLite configuration with dynamic settings using `dj_database_url` and `DATABASE_URL` environment variable. This change improves flexibility and prepares the project for different deployment environments. Unused database configurations have been commented out for clarity.

Update database configuration to use environment variables
Replaced `os.getenv` with `decouple.config` for retrieving the `DATABASE_URL`. This improves security, flexibility, and compatibility across various environments. Adjusted settings to align with best practices for managing environment-specific configurations.

Refactor settings and Docker configuration.
Replaced `decouple.config` with `os.getenv` for environment variable management in settings, improving compatibility. Consolidated and streamlined Docker setup by revising commands, removing redundant steps, and adjusting the `env_file` format. These changes enhance maintainability and simplify project deployment.

Refactor Dockerfile to include superuser creation.
Updated the Dockerfile to add a step for creating a superuser during the start-up process. This ensures better automation and consistency in the deployment workflow. Also refined related configuration and comments for clarity and maintainability.

Update Celery config to use environment variables
Replaced hardcoded Redis URLs in Celery configuration with values retrieved from environment variables using `os.environ.get`. This improves flexibility and allows for easier adjustments across environments. Default values are preserved for local development.

Update Dockerfile to remove superuser creation step
Removed the automatic superuser creation step from the Dockerfile startup command. This streamlines the deployment process and avoids potential issues during container initialization. Manual superuser creation can now be handled separately if needed.

Refactor Celery, admin, and Docker configurations.
Updated Celery settings to support Redis URLs with SSL and refined admin methods for better clarity and functionality. Removed the automatic superuser creation step from Dockerfile for streamlined deployment. Adjusted `docker-compose.yml` and other configurations to enhance maintainability and compatibility.

Refactor admin display and comment out unused method
Removed the `get_notified_subscribers_count` field from `list_display` in `CoupureAdmin` and commented out its corresponding method for clarity. These changes simplify the admin interface and remove unused functionality while preserving the method for potential future use.

Refactor Celery configuration for better SSL support
Simplified Celery settings by using `broker_use_ssl` for SSL configuration with Redis URLs. This approach eliminates redundant logic while ensuring compatibility with `rediss://` connections. Adjusted relevant settings and initialization in `celery.py` accordingly.

Refactor Celery configuration for better SSL support
Updated Celery settings to use SSL-compatible Redis URLs, ensuring compatibility with `rediss://` connections. Simplified configuration by adjusting relevant settings and initialization in `settings.py` and `celery.py`. This enhances security and eliminates redundant logic.
